sentences.english: You went into far Ku-to-yen, by the river of swirling eddies.
sentences.chinese: 你去了瞿塘滟滪堆，紧挨着那条河，密密麻麻的漩涡。

sentences.english: The liquidity of subprime-mortgage securities was at the heart of the credit crisis.
sentences.chinese: 次级抵押证券的流动性，处于信贷危机的漩涡中心。

sentences.english: The strong gusts whipped up eddies of fallen leaves.
sentences.chinese: 强劲的阵风激起了落叶漩涡。

sentences.english: The whirlpool sucked in the boat.
They take their luck with currents, and create tiny eddies to guide food toward their tendrils.
sentences.chinese: 它们利用电流，制造出小漩涡，让食物流向卷须。

sentences.english: And in the eddy that does not let oneself be immersed in imitate to inscribe a mark.
sentences.chinese: 而不要让自己陷入模拟题分数的漩涡之中。

sentences.english: The whirlpool sucked down the canoe.
I love naruto . Especially vortex naruto .
sentences.chinese: 我爱火影忍者，尤其是漩涡鸣人。

sentences.english: Teacher education can not still pull itself from technical whirlpool.
sentences.chinese: 在今天，教师教育依然在技术主义的漩涡里不可自拔。

sentences.english: Like Yubari, Japan is heading into a demographic vortex.
sentences.chinese: 夕张市是一个写照，整个日本正陷入人口问题的漩涡。

sentences.english: The canoe was sucked into the whirlpool.
sentences.chinese: 他被卷入政治的漩涡中。

sentences.english: Maxis lets us take the new Spore expansion for a whirl.
sentences.chinese: 明让我们采取新的孢子扩大的漩涡。

sentences.english: The whirlpool sucked down the boat.
A swirl of first impressions raced through Malone’s mind.
sentences.chinese: 第一印象的漩涡冲过马龙的思维。

sentences.english: Clouds swirl on Saturn, the second largest planet in our solar system.
sentences.chinese: 云层在土星上打漩涡，土星是太阳系中第二个大行星。

sentences.english: Always look upstream before leaving eddies to run or play.
sentences.chinese: 离开漩涡前总是向上看。

definition: storm/violent commotion/fig. crisis (e.g. revolution, uprising, financial crisis etc)
a powerful current/a flood (often fig., e.g. a flood of ideas)
so deep one cannot see to the bottom/limitless
